def_cn: 想;认为
def_en: If you think that something is the case, you have the opinion that it is the case.

def_cn: 感觉;觉得
def_en: If you say that you think that something is true or will happen, you mean that you have the impression that it is true or will happen, although you are not certain of the facts.

def_cn: （以某种方式）考虑，思考
def_en: If you think in a particular way, you have those general opinions or attitudes.

def_cn: 想;考虑;思考
def_en: When you think about ideas or problems, you make a mental effort to consider them.

def_cn: (以某种方式)考虑，思考
def_en: If you think in a particular way, you consider things, solve problems, or make decisions in this way, for example because of your job or your background.

def_cn: 想到;想起;想出
def_en: If you think of something, it comes into your mind or you remember it.

def_cn: 想出，想到(主意)
def_en: If you think of an idea, you make a mental effort and use your imagination and intelligence to create it or develop it.

def_cn: 心里想;琢磨
def_en: If you are thinking something at a particular moment, you have words or ideas in your mind without saying them out loud.

def_cn: 认为，以为(人或物具有某特点或用途)
def_en: If you think of someone or something as having a particular quality or purpose, you regard them as having this quality or purpose.

def_cn: 对…评价(很高)
def_en: If you think a lot of someone or something, you admire them very much or think they are very good.

def_cn: 关心;考虑;为…着想
def_en: If you think of someone, you show consideration for them and pay attention to their needs.

def_cn: 考虑;打算
def_en: If you are thinking of taking a particular course of action, you are considering it as a possible course of action.

def_cn: (用来引出例子或进一步解释)考虑,想到(某方面、某主题)
def_en: You can say that you are thinking of a particular aspect or subject, in order to introduce an example or explain more exactly what you are talking about.

def_cn: (用于问句，表示生气、震惊)认为，以为
def_en: You use think in questions where you are expressing your anger or shock at someone's behaviour.

def_cn: 想来，想想看(用于评论过去所做或经历过的事情现在看来不可思议、愚蠢或令人震惊)
def_en: You use think when you are commenting on something which you did or experienced in the past and which now seems surprising, foolish, or shocking to you.

def_cn: 本来以为，原以为(用于批评别人该做某事而未做)
def_en: You can use think in expressions such as you would think or I would have thought when you are criticizing someone because they ought to or could be expected to do something, but have not done it.

def_cn: 谁都会以为/你会认为(用于对他人的行为表示惊讶或不满)
def_en: You can use think in expressions such as anyone would think and you would think to express your surprise or disapproval at the way someone is behaving.
thinking; thought;

def_cn: (表示突然记起或意识到某事)想起来了，想想看
def_en: You use expressions such as come to think of it ,when you think about it, or thinking about it, when you mention something that you have suddenly remembered or realized.

def_cn: 我想，我觉得(用于委婉地解释等)
def_en: You use 'I think' as a way of being polite when you are explaining or suggesting to someone what you want to do, or when you are accepting or refusing an offer.

def_cn: 我认为，我想(用于会话或讲话中，使语气稍显婉转)
def_en: You use 'I think' in conversations or speeches to make your statements and opinions sound less forceful, rude, or direct.

def_cn: 你想一想，想象一下(表示激动、着迷或震惊，同时希望谈话对方也有同感)
def_en: You say just think when you feel excited, fascinated, or shocked by something, and you want the person to whom you are talking to feel the same.

def_cn: 重新考虑，再三斟酌(常指最终改变主意)
def_en: If you think again about an action or decision, you consider it very carefully, often with the result that you change your mind and decide to do things differently.

def_cn: 认为…没什么了不起;觉得…很容易;认为…无所谓
def_en: If you think nothing of doing something that other people might consider difficult, strange, or wrong, you consider it to be easy or normal, and you do it often or would be quite willing to do it.

def_cn: 对…不在意;不觉得…奇怪(或重要)
def_en: If something happens and you think nothing of it, you do not pay much attention to it or think of it as strange or important, although later you realize that it is.

you can't hear yourself think→see: hear;  to shudder to think→see: shudder;  to think better of it→see: better;  to think big→see: big;  to think twice→see: twice;  to think the world of someone→see: world;
